intro: Cruciata taurica subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western Caucasian cruciata, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to the Caucasus region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
